name: Micah Vale
overview: FIELD SYNOPSIS: Unhoused adolescent recovered from gang activity, now permanently bonded to parasitic entity codename VEIN. Symbiote enables full-body mass conversion and multiple secondary combat adaptations; entity displays independent cognition and overt predatory affect while remaining highly protective of host. Subject favors vertical terrain, ambush, and rapid exfiltration, using the symbiote as both shock weapon and intimidation tool. Threat assessment: EMBER in dense urban environments; control vectors likely limited to emotional leverage on host.

merits.narrative: Micah looks like an underfed runaway, so guards forget he's in the room until he slips through vents or cluttered rafters.
Years of rooftop squatting left Micah with feral parkour instincts, so apartment blocks become ladders for hit-and-run ambushes.
Constant hustle trained Micah to watch wrists and wallets, lifting credentials before marks realize he's even brushed past them.
When Vein surfaces, Micah melts into pipes and rafters, hanging motionless above targets until they're convinced the room is clear.

vars.techniqueRules: Micah is especially stealthy when wielding the impossible maneuverability of Brachiation: He can maneuver into places where ordinary people could not hide — such as crouching against a ceiling or lurking in a pond — then contort himself into something that is almost invisible, gaining a +3 bonus to all relevant Stealth rolls.{{BR}}Having mastered this Technique, this bonus derives from the higher of Scar Power or Variation Magnitude.

scars.narrative: Vein is Micah's blood, and Micah's body is all that contains the symbiote. When Micah bleeds, whether willingly (by cutting himself to voluntarily transform into Vein) or unwillingly (by suffering an injury), the transformation into Vein is governed entirely by blood escaping the containment of Micah's body.

Given how easily Vein can escape, and how unpredictable Vein is when he does, Micah is understandably wary of suffering even mild wounds -- wounds that might release the symbiote whether Micah wants it or not. This leads to caution at best, cowardice at worst.

As Micah's innate (i.e. permanent/perpetual) abilities grow, they come at a cost: Vein's lessons come with increasing influence, and recently Vein has managed to seize control of Micah's body entirely, relegating Micah to backseat driver in his own body. Fortunately, these events are rare and short-lived, but Vein is always offering more power if Micah will cede just a little more of his control...

variations.narrative: When Vein escapes his containment, every drop of blood in Micah's body rushes out to consume him in an all-encompassing torrent, drowning the adolescent in crimson. What remains is a nightmare of coagulated blood only vaguely human in shape, a lethal instrument of stealth and destruction.

secondaryVariations.narrative: In liquid form, Vein moves with a fluidity and grace that defies gravity: the distinctions between ceilings, walls and floors become merely academic.
Vein's blood is anathema to human biology, and under the symbiote's perfect control it becomes a weapon: an explosion of deadly tendrils of caustic red poison.
Vein's weaponized blood ensnares and strangles even as its alien pathogens assault human tissue and corrode inorganic matter.

variations.narrative: Even when Vein is safely contained, the symbiote can quickly staunch internal bleeding and mend wounds in an instant. Micah still feels the pain, though, and -- worst of all -- he still bleeds.
Vein's alien instincts are honed to a razor's edge, and Micah has learned to listen to the whispers in the back of his mind -- despite the constant cost of cedeing control to the alien within.
Vein's symbiotic adaptations grant Micah superhuman agility and reflexes, allowing him to perform feats of athleticism that would be impossible for a human.
